attributes.action: Ban primary schools from offering attendance awards
attributes.additional_details:
Awarding children for being well is confusing; Why reward luck?
 
These awards target parental decisions; primary pupils have little input.
 
I believe that it’s detrimental to society to encourage people to infect others by leaving home when unwell.
 
I believe that awards for attendance are unfair. They penalise students who have been ill through no fault of their own. Why punish that? 
 
I believe that they discourage schools from implementing tailored and effective support, replacing that with awards instead.
 
They could detrimentally impact SEND and disabled pupils (likely to have lower attendance) which I believe is discrimination against a protected group under the Equality Act.
 
Finally, some research suggests that attendance awards are counter-productive!
attributes.background: Ban attendance awards of all forms, including class and individual ones.
